title: newdad11
author: newdad11
content: I have been following NFTs on twitter for a while now and a couple of creators have come to my attentionI don't personally have the fund to invest, however thought this might be interesting for anyone that does.I have linked their collections to this post as neither has a huge following as of yet, however I feel they both deserve more and these would be great projects to invest in from ground level.Here is the first one (photography): https://opensea.io/collection/flicks-from-lagosThis is a beautifully crafted photography collection, and we have seen photography be very popular in the nft space as of late. The collection is going for relatively cheap now as well so there is definitely value to be made. There is only one location on this, but as he states on his twitter, he is always building his collection, and this one would be a great investment for anyone looking to gain a quick buck in value.twitter handle: @ogbeniyardHere is the second one (poetry):https://opensea.io/collection/provocative-poetryThis a poetry collection about the corruption in our world at the moment, there are 7 poems here with completely different themes and structures. The creator has been advertising the entire collection on twitter for as little as 2.5 Ethereum, and in my opinion this collection could be worth six figures in 3-5 years time. This is a great time to get in on a revolutionary piece of work. twitter handle: @PoetryaProbityLet me know what you think of these collectionsThought I'd leave them here for anyone who enjoys investing in NFTsPeace

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Are people still interested in NFTs? I've seen those millions worth in dollars became almost useless and worthless. I guess if you're really for the art and you're a fan of the artist, there's a good reason to follow and buy their digital arts.There really are exceptional artists that are underrated and needs recognition. But on a perspective as an investor, these days you need to be wiser with your decision. If it's an extra money, I guess it's fine if you can afford it.

comments.author: hyudien
comments.body: What are you really looking for in NFT? huge profits and unreasonable prices? don't expect it to actually materialize when now NFT has become a hotbed of art scams and even I think the NFT hype is slowly fading away. If the NFT you hold does not have a type of scarcity and high demand it will only be a waste of time and money. If I have funds and must have an investment in NFT or in crypto then crypto is the more efficient to choose. You may own NFT by pegging a high price and selling it on Opensea then compare it to crypto listed on major exchanges. You can find faster selling speeds in crypto but in NFT it doesn't necessarily sell quickly.

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: From what I observed, NFTs related to collectibles is much risky to invest with. It needs hype and there's no big reason why should we collect those unless a big fan or just want to simply collect it. Even those NFT's related to popular personalities aren't that hype. I know there are NFT collectibles that got hyped before but it's only few.It's really risky to invest in NFT nowadays as it requires lots of factors to consider before placing a money with a specific NFT.My suggestion is not to stop being a NFT fan. Just continue to follow those you prefer and use your best skill in terms of DYOR before putting money. You should also looked for other worthy investments outside NFT instead.
